block.p: The Communication Minister of India, Ram Vilas Paswan, told Parliament the country would take investments worth about $78 billion to increase telephone density in the country to the developed-world level of 16 per 100 people by 2010, compared with 3 per 100 people now. The state-run telephone companies Videsh Sanchar Nigam Ltd. and Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd. had enjoyed a monopoly over international and domestic long-distance telephone services till recently. Now six private companies have secured licenses for providing fixed-line telephone services in India, and the government has said it intends to fully privatize the telephone business by 2004.
